Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Activity
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Conflict
    public class Event
extends Activity
    The Event class is responsible for creating valid Event objects by passing an Event's title, meeting days, start time, end time, and checking event details to make sure they are valid
    Author:
    Jake Donovan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Event​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String meetingDays, int startTime, int endTime, java.lang.String eventDetails)
      Event class constructor creates an Event object by passing parameters to Activity super class and passes event details to setter method within Event class to finalize the Event object (Finalize = all Event details are connected to Event object and initialized)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String getEventDetails()
      Returns Event details
      java.lang.String[] getLongDisplayArray()
      Returns all details on an Event object as a long display including an Event's title, meeting string (aka meeting days and start/end times), and an Event's details (Note: all remaining fields are empty Strings) because an Event does not have a name, section, credits, or instructorId like Course)
      java.lang.String[] getShortDisplayArray()
      Returns details on an Event object as a short display including an Event's title, and meeting string (aka meeting days and start/end times) (Note: all remaining fields are empty Strings because an Event will not have a name or section like Course)
      boolean isDuplicate​(Activity activity)
      This method is responsible for checking for duplicate Event's within a student's schedule, this method will first check if a passed activity is an instance of Event and then checking if that Event already exists within a student's schedule, this method will achieve by being called several times through the use of a for loop in WolfScheduler class and will compare the activity's title against Event titles within schedule, if the activity is actually a Course this method will return false
      void setEventDetails​(java.lang.String eventDetails)
      Sets Event details
      void setMeetingDaysAndTime​(java.lang.String meetingDays, int startTime, int endTime)
      This method is responsible checking Event objects to verify that they are valid Events by overriding Activity superclass setMeetingDays method and then this method will pass to setMeetingDays method within superclass for final checks and final assignment
      java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides super class implementation of toString() to return an Event's title, meeting days, starting time, and ending time as a string

      • Methods inherited from class edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Activity

        checkConflict, equals, getEndTime, getMeetingDays, getMeetingString, getStartTime, getTitle, hashCode, setTitle

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event​(java.lang.String title,
             java.lang.String meetingDays,
             int startTime,
             int endTime,
             java.lang.String eventDetails)
        Event class constructor creates an Event object by passing parameters to Activity super class and passes event details to setter method within Event class to finalize the Event object (Finalize = all Event details are connected to Event object and initialized)
        Parameters:
        title - an Event's title
        meetingDays - an Event's meeting days
        startTime - an Event's starting time
        endTime - an Event's ending time
        eventDetails - an Event's details

    • Method Detail

      • getEventDetails

        public java.lang.String getEventDetails()
        Returns Event details
        Returns:
        eventDetails the Event details

      • setEventDetails

        public void setEventDetails​(java.lang.String eventDetails)
        Sets Event details
        Parameters:
        eventDetails - the Event's details
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if event details are null, event details are optional so event details can be an empty String

      • getShortDisplayArray

        public java.lang.String[] getShortDisplayArray()
        Returns details on an Event object as a short display including an Event's title, and meeting string (aka meeting days and start/end times) (Note: all remaining fields are empty Strings because an Event will not have a name or section like Course)
        Specified by:
        getShortDisplayArray in class Activity
        Returns:
        shortDisplay a String array containing all information (listed in above comment) on an Event

      • getLongDisplayArray

        public java.lang.String[] getLongDisplayArray()
        Returns all details on an Event object as a long display including an Event's title, meeting string (aka meeting days and start/end times), and an Event's details (Note: all remaining fields are empty Strings) because an Event does not have a name, section, credits, or instructorId like Course)
        Specified by:
        getLongDisplayArray in class Activity
        Returns:
        longDisplay a String array containing all information (listed in above comment) on an Event

      • setMeetingDaysAndTime

        public void setMeetingDaysAndTime​(java.lang.String meetingDays,
                                  int startTime,
                                  int endTime)
        This method is responsible checking Event objects to verify that they are valid Events by overriding Activity superclass setMeetingDays method and then this method will pass to setMeetingDays method within superclass for final checks and final assignment
        Overrides:
        setMeetingDaysAndTime in class Activity
        Parameters:
        meetingDays - an Event's meeting days
        startTime - an Event's starting time
        endTime - an Event's ending time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any weekday letter other than M, T, W, H, F, S, U appear within an Event's meeting days, and if a valid weekday appears more than once for an Event's meeting days

      • isDuplicate

        public boolean isDuplicate​(Activity activity)
        This method is responsible for checking for duplicate Event's within a student's schedule, this method will first check if a passed activity is an instance of Event and then checking if that Event already exists within a student's schedule, this method will achieve by being called several times through the use of a for loop in WolfScheduler class and will compare the activity's title against Event titles within schedule, if the activity is actually a Course this method will return false
        Specified by:
        isDuplicate in class Activity
        Parameters:
        activity - a passed activity that can be either a Course or Event
        Returns:
        true if the passed activity is a duplicate Course (already in student's schedule) otherwise this method will return false

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides super class implementation of toString() to return an Event's title, meeting days, starting time, and ending time as a string
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String a string containing all information (listed in above comment) on an Event as a string
